frame.name: Ammunition
frame.definition:
<def-root>A piece of <fen>Ammunition</fen> is a disposable artifact to be fired as a projectile in a weapon with the purpose of causing harm or damage.
<ex>The octagenarian inventor's vest repels <fex name="Use">armor-piercing</fex> <t><fex name="amm">bullets</fex></t>. </ex>
<ex>It is armed with a automatic loaded 105 mm gun firing <fex name="Use">anti-tank</fex> <t><fex name="amm">rounds</fex></t></ex>
<ex><fex name="Material">Depleted uranium</fex> <t><fex name="amm">munitions</fex></t> are primarily used by the US and the UK.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Ammunition
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Ammunition</fen> that is designed to have a particular <fen>Use</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition: <def-root>The use for which a piece of ammunition is intended.</def-root>

FE.name: Creator
FE.definition: <def-root>An individual or individuals that bring the <fen>Ammunition</fen> into existence.</def-root>

FE.name: Time_of_creation
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which an <fen>Ammunition</fen> comes into existence.</def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition: <def-root>The term used to refer to an <fen>Ammunition</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition: <def-root>Any indication of what makes up the <fen>Ammunition</fen>, including components, ingredients, etc.</def-root>

FE.name: Weapon
FE.definition:
<def-root>The weapon that the <fen>Ammunition</fen> is used in.
<ex><t>Ammo</t> <fex name="Weapon">for an AK-47</fex> was found in the bedroom .</ex> <ex><fex name="Weapon">Shotgun</fex> <t>shells</t>, unlike simple balls, cannot be reused .</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: ammunition.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a supply or quantity of bullets and shells

lexUnit.name: ordnance.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: ammunition for heavy weapons (including missiles and large rounds)

lexUnit.name: round.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the amount of ammunition needed to fire one shot

lexUnit.name: bullet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a projectile fired from a small firearm, typically metal, cylindrical and pointed.

lexUnit.name: shell.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: ammunition made from several materials, with a solid outer layer and an inner payload of explosives or shot.
